page.title: 02Filleigh Church
page.content: The church is on the A361 in the main village. It was built in 1730 to replace an older, smaller one. The license was granted by the Bishop of Exeter. The roof was recently retiled at a cost of ten thousand pounds. The tiles came from Bridgewater. The stained-glass windows are Victorian but at the tower end there are modern windows. In the tower there are six bells. There are two bell-ringing teams; one younger and one older, the youngest ringer in the tower being nine years old. There is a Sunday school, and services at 10.00 a.m. each Sunday. Inside the church there is a bookstall selling religious books. In the churchyard there is the grave of Phillipa Collins who died at the age of 101, a servant of the Fortescue family for over fifty years.
